benchmark_details.name: MultiStAR (Multi-Stage Abstract Visual Reasoning)
benchmark_details.overview: MultiStAR is a benchmark designed to evaluate Multimodal Large Language Models (MLLMs) during the abstract visual reasoning (AVR) process through two subtasks: Direct Answer and Logical Chain, focusing on intermediate reasoning steps.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To assess reasoning across varying levels of complexity in MLLMs while accounting for both intermediate and final answers in abstract visual reasoning tasks.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The intermediate task generation is restricted to datasets with defined object attributes; limits applicability to other AVR datasets lacking such metadata.

data.source: Derived from the RA VEN dataset.
data.size: 8,100 examples for Direct Answer; 560 examples for Logical Chain.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is computed as the proportion of correct answers. MSEval aggregates correctness across all reasoning stages.
methodology.interpretation: MSEval provides a more granular analysis of the modelâ€™s performance, reflecting the correctness of both intermediate steps and final answers.
methodology.baseline_results: Human performance serves as a baseline with ratings exceeding 60% across tasks.
methodology.validation: Evaluated through tests against human performances and model capabilities.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Evaluation conducted for diverse demographics from crowdsourced human studies.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Informed consent obtained from human participants for data collection.
